question.title: Issue with WebSockets Implementation in Spring Boot (Backend) and Android (Frontend)
question.body:
I'm trying to implement WebSockets in my application. On the backend, I’m using Spring Boot with @EnableWebSocketMessageBroker, and on the frontend, I’m using the Stomp library in Android. However, I’m facing some issues that I need help with.

Issues I'm Facing:

  1. WebSocket Connection Issue:

    • Sometimes the connection to the WebSocket server is not established immediately.
    • Are there any best practices for handling reconnections properly?

  2. Receiving Messages on Android:

    • The messages are not always received in real-time.
    • Is there a proper way to ensure that messages are correctly received, and can I verify if my subscription is working?

  3. Backend Configuration:

    • Am I configuring the backend WebSocket server correctly?
    • Do I need to make any additional configurations for better performance?

Backend: WebSocket Configuration (Spring Boot)

@Configuration
@EnableWebSocketMessageBroker // Enables WebSocket message handling
public class WebSocketConfig implements WebSocketMessageBrokerConfigurer {

    @Override
    public void configureMessageBroker(MessageBrokerRegistry config) {
        config.enableSimpleBroker("/topic"); // Prefix for subscribing to topics
        config.setApplicationDestinationPrefixes("/app"); // Prefix for sending messages
    }

    @Override
    public void registerStompEndpoints(StompEndpointRegistry registry) {
        registry.addEndpoint("/ws").withSockJS(); // WebSocket endpoint
    }
}

Frontend: WebSocket Client Implementation in Android (Kotlin)

package com.talhaatif.tickojet.data.remote.client

import android.util.Log
import com.google.gson.Gson
import com.talhaatif.tickojet.responseModel.SeatUpdate
import ua.naiksoftware.stomp.Stomp
import ua.naiksoftware.stomp.StompClient
import ua.naiksoftware.stomp.dto.StompMessage

class WebSocketClient(
    private val eventId: String,
    private val onSeatUpdate: (List<String>, String) -> Unit
) {
    private val stompClient: StompClient =
        Stomp.over(Stomp.ConnectionProvider.OKHTTP, "wss://tickojet-8f5e27f79912.herokuapp.com/ws")
    private val gson = Gson()

    fun connect() {
        stompClient.connect()
        stompClient.topic("/topic/seats/$eventId").subscribe { message ->
            try {
                val seatUpdate = gson.fromJson(message.payload, SeatUpdate::class.java)
                Log.d("WebSocket", "Received update: ${seatUpdate.seatNumbers}, ${seatUpdate.status}")
                onSeatUpdate(seatUpdate.seatNumbers, seatUpdate.status)
            } catch (e: Exception) {
                Log.e("WebSocket", "Error parsing message", e)
            }
        }
    }

    fun disconnect() {
        stompClient.disconnect()
    }
}

Questions:

  1. Am I handling WebSocket subscriptions correctly in Android?
  2. Is there a way to verify whether the WebSocket subscription is successfully receiving messages?
  3. Are there any recommended best practices for handling WebSocket reconnections in Android?
  4. Do I need additional configurations in my Spring Boot backend to improve performance or stability?

Any help would be greatly appreciated! 🚀 Thanks in advance.
